org.easylibs.options

Interface BeanOption

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Option<java.lang.Object>

    public interface BeanOption
extends Option<java.lang.Object>

    Bean option that gets its name from a reflected class member's name or if any members are annoted with Arg annotation, the Arg.name() attribute of the annotation. Class member names are used as option names, when the annotation doesn't provide an explicit name, using the Arg.name() attribute. The class member name is converted to a dash separated form from the standard java naming convention of capitalized words concatenated together.

    The bean option value modifies the class member value when it is set. Each bean option maintains a TypeMapper instance which allows it to translate the command line string argument to the correct type for the class member. The mappings are maintained in a registry and new types can be registered during the creation of the Options object using its builder.

    Full member type and generic/component type mappings are maintained in the registry for collections and arrays as class member types.
